excerpt: Boat rides are offered on this artificial freshwater lake featuring islands with palaces.
detail_description: Lake Pichola, an artificial freshwater lake in Udaipur, Rajasthan, offers boat rides and is home to several islands with palaces. Built in 1362, it was initially intended to meet the city's water and irrigation needs. The lake has four islands including Arsi villa & Jag Niwas, which houses a small palace and a sanctuary for bird watching.
name: Lake Pichola
address: Pichola, Udaipur, Rajasthan 313001

excerpt: Ornate 1700s palace home to a museum with traditional costumes, puppets & folk dance performances.
detail_description: Bagore Ki Haveli is an ornate 18th-century palace located near Gangaur Ghat on the banks of Lake Pichola in Udaipur. This historic building, constructed between 1751 and 1778, boasts over 100 rooms showcasing traditional costumes, puppets, antique items such as jewelry boxes and copper utensils, as well as modern art. The interior features intricate mirror and glass work that adds to its allure.
name: Bagore Ki Haveli
address: HMJJ+2W6, Old City, Pichola, Udaipur, Rajasthan 313001, India

excerpt: Hilltop white marble palace surrounded by a wildlife sanctuary & offering panoramic city views.
detail_description: Sajjangarh Monsoon Palace, also known as Monsoon Mahal, is a stunning white marble palace perched on a high hill in Udaipur. Built by Maharana Sajjan Singh of the Mewar Dynasty, this palace offers breathtaking panoramic views of Fatehsagar Lake and the surrounding countryside.
name: Monsoon Palace
address: Udaipur, Kodiyat, Rajasthan 313011, India

detail_description: Saheliyon ki Bari, a stunning garden in Udaipur, is renowned for its lush greenery, intricate marble art, and enchanting fountains. Built by the Maharana for the royal ladies of Mewar, it features four water pools, marble elephants, kiosks, and fountains. The garden also houses a museum displaying household items and pets of the residents.
name: Saheliyon ki bari
address: Panchwati, Udaipur, Rajasthan 313001, India

excerpt: Shilpgram, a rural district bordering Fateh Sagar Lake, is known for Shilpgram Crafts Village, a sprawling open-air attraction with traditional-style huts containing tools and everyday items from diverse regions of western India. Artisans demonstrate craft making, a bazaar sells handicrafts and Rajasthani textiles, and an amphitheater hosts live music and folk dancing. A few relaxed eateries dot the countryside.
detail_description: Shilpgram, located near Fateh Sagar Lake in a rural district, is home to the Shilpgram Crafts Village. This expansive open-air attraction features traditional huts showcasing tools and everyday items from different regions of western India. Visitors can witness artisans demonstrating craft making, explore a bazaar offering handicrafts and Rajasthani textiles, and enjoy live music and folk dancing at the amphitheater.
name: Shilpgram
address: Udaipur, Rajasthan, India

detail_description: Fateh Sagar Lake offers a chance to savor the delightful kulhad coffee, a beloved choice for both locals and tourists. Enjoy this special beverage in a traditional clay cup while taking a leisurely evening walk by the lake. It's an experience that has captivated many visitors and is definitely worth trying during your visit.
name: Fateh Sagar Lake
address: Udaipur, Rajasthan 313001, India

excerpt: The palaces of 11 separate rulers sit together in this sprawling complex that was started in 1559.
detail_description: The City Palace in Udaipur, Rajasthan is a sprawling complex that houses the palaces of 11 different rulers. It stands tall above Lake Pichola and offers stunning lakeside views. The palace boasts a facade that stretches almost 250 meters in length and rises over 30 meters in height. Visitors can enter through the Baripol Gate or the Tripolia Gate, both dating back to the 17th and 18th centuries.
name: City Palace
address: Old City, Udaipur, Rajasthan 313001, India

detail_description: The Vintage & Classic Car Collection, located in The Palace, Udaipur, is a must-visit for car enthusiasts and first-time visitors to the City of Lakes. Housed in the former Mewar State Motor Garage, this museum showcases an impressive array of vintage vehicles, including luxurious cars like the 1934 Rolls-Royce Phantom II that was converted into a pick-up truck for royal hunts.
name: Vintage & Classic Car Collection, The Palace, Udaipur
address: HMGV+5VX, Old City, Ganga Gali, Udaipur, Rajasthan 313001, India

excerpt: Landmark Hindu temple featuring detailed carvings on the facade, plus statues & other art.
detail_description: Jagdish Temple is a significant Hindu temple in Udaipur, dedicated to Lord Vishnu. The 16th-century structure showcases intricate carvings depicting ancient Hindu legends. Visitors can witness spiritual ceremonies conducted by Brahmins and devotees inside the temple. While entrance is free, donations are welcomed. Another notable temple in Udaipur is Mahakaleshwar Temple, dedicated to Lord Shiva and located along the banks of Fateh Sagar Lake.
name: Jagdish Temple
address: Old City, Udaipur, Rajasthan 313001, India

excerpt: The palaces of 11 separate rulers sit together in this sprawling complex that was started in 1559.
detail_description: Begin your day in Udaipur with a visit to the majestic City Palace, an iconic landmark that offers breathtaking views of the city. Constructed in 1559 by Maharana Udai Singh II, this sprawling complex has been expanded over the centuries by successive Maharanas, resulting in a stunning array of palaces and mahals. As you explore the palace, you'll be immersed in the grandeur and opulence of Rajasthan's royal history.
name: City Palace
address: Old City, Udaipur, Rajasthan 313001, India

excerpt: This artificial lake created in 1678 has 3 islands in the middle, 2 of which are public parks.
detail_description: Fateh Sagar Lake, constructed in 1678 and later remodeled, is a renowned artificial lake in Udaipur. Spanning about 2.5 kilometers, it boasts three islands - one featuring water-jet fountains, another housing the Udaipur Solar Observatory, and the third hosting Nehru Park with a small zoo. The lake offers boat rides at affordable rates and serves as an important tourist attraction in Rajasthan's tourism landscape.
name: Fateh Sagar Lake
address: Udaipur, Rajasthan 313001

excerpt: Landmark Hindu temple featuring detailed carvings on the facade, plus statues & other art.
detail_description: Jagdish Temple, located in Udaipur, is a magnificent Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Vishnu. It was constructed by Maharana Jagat Singh in the 17th century and showcases stunning architecture with finely carved pillars and intricate ceilings. The temple's design adheres to Vedic Vastushastra principles, making it a beautiful and culturally significant site to visit.
name: Jagdish Temple
address: Old City, Udaipur, Rajasthan 313001, India

excerpt: Established in 1952, this cultural heritage museum features Rajasthani folk art, dance & literature.
detail_description: Bhartiya Lok Kala Mandal, established in 1952, is a cultural institute dedicated to preserving India's traditional art forms. Located near Bharatiya Lok Kala Mandir in Udaipur, Rajasthan, the museum showcases Rajasthani folk art, dance, literature and artifacts through various events. It aims to raise awareness about Indian culture and encourages participation in traditional art forms.
name: Bhartiya Lok Kala Mandal
address: Near, Bhartiya Lok Kala Mandir, Chetak Cir, Udaipur, Rajasthan 313001, India

excerpt: Promenade, bathing steps & sunset spot offering views of palaces & hotels around Lake Pichola.
detail_description: Ambrai Ghat is a picturesque spot located on the banks of Lake Pichola, offering stunning views of the surrounding palaces and hotels. It's a popular place to capture beautiful sunset scenes and enjoy the serene atmosphere. Visitors can take a leisurely stroll along the ghat, feel the refreshing breeze, and admire the splendor of Lake Pichola. The area is also known for its photogenic appeal, making it an ideal location for photo shoots without breaking the bank.
name: Ambrai Ghat
address: Chandpole Maji, Ka Mandir corner of Lake, Cheerwa, Pichola, Udaipur, Rajasthan 313001, India

excerpt: Small museum with sculptures & artifacts dating to the 10th century, plus cenotaphs of royal rulers.
detail_description: The Ahar Museum, situated on the outskirts of Udaipur in Ahar, India, is a small but fascinating museum showcasing sculptures and artifacts dating back to the 10th century. The collection includes ancient earthenware pottery, unique sculptures, a remarkable metal Buddha, and archaeological relics spanning over 3,500 years. Additionally, the museum houses around 20 royal cenotaphs of renowned Mewar maharajas.
name: Ahar Museum
address: Main Rd, Ayad, Ganapati Nagar, Udaipur, Rajasthan 313001, India

excerpt: Yoga, jogging & outdoor gym equipment in a hillside expanse of paths & fountains under tall trees.
detail_description: Gulab Bagh, also known as the Rose Garden, is a popular destination in Udaipur. This expansive garden features well-kept roses and is home to the Gulab Bagh Zoo. The park offers a serene environment with jogging paths, fountains, and outdoor gym equipment nestled among tall trees on a hillside. Visitors can explore the Navlakha Palace and Kamal Talai, an artificial lake that adds to the beauty of the palace.
name: Gulab Bagh
address: HMCV+V3H, Gulab Bagh Rd, Udaipur, Rajasthan 313001, India

excerpt: Assorted parks, small shops & temples line this lakeside vehicular road with panoramic views.
detail_description: Maharana Pratap Memorial Road is a lakeside vehicular road with stunning panoramic views, featuring assorted parks, small shops, and temples. At the highest point of Moti Magri, overlooking Fateh Sagar Lake, stands an impressive bronze statue of Maharana Pratap on his faithful horse Chetak. This memorial pays homage to the heroic king and his loyal mount, known for saving his life in the battle of Haldighati.
name: Maharana Pratap Memorial Road
address: Udaipur, Rajasthan 313001, India

excerpt: Striking white solar observatory located on a tiny islet in Fateh Sagar Lake.
detail_description: The Udaipur Solar Observatory is a stunning white structure situated on a small island in Fateh Sagar Lake. Regarded as the best solar observatory in Asia, it is modeled after the Big Bear Lake solar observatory in California. Its unique location on an island provides ideal conditions for celestial observations, with clear and unpolluted skies. Equipped with powerful telescopes and advanced technology, it allows for high-resolution imaging of the sun and precise astronomical research. Established under the guidance of Dr.
name: Udaipur Solar Observatory
address: JM3F+PJF, Lake Fatehpur to Badi Talai, Rani Rd, Near Fatehpur, Shilpgram, Udaipur, Rajasthan 313001, India

excerpt: Hilltop site commemorating a 16th-century battle, with statues, an evening light show & a museum.
detail_description: Nestled atop the scenic Moti Magri, overlooking the serene Fateh Sagar Lake in Udaipur, lies the Maharana Pratap Smarak. This historic memorial honors the valiant Rajput king, Maharana Pratap Singh, and his steadfast horse Chetak. Established in 1948 through a public initiative led by Maharana Bhagwat Singh Mewar, it features a striking life-sized bronze statue of the warrior on horseback.
name: Maharana Pratap Smarak Samiti Moti Magri
address: Fateh Sagar Rd, Malla Talai, Udaipur, Rajasthan 313001, India

detail_description: Ahar Cenotaphs, also known as Maha Satya, is a significant archaeological site in Udaipur. It served as a prominent burial ground for the royal family and boasts a collection of rare monuments dating back to the 10th century. The site features over 250 cenotaphs of the maharajas of Mewar, each showcasing unique architectural designs.
name: Ahar cenotaphs/ Maha Satya
address: HPP9+RXV, Ahar Museum, Ayad, Ganapati Nagar, Udaipur, Rajasthan 313001, India

detail_description: Nestled along the serene banks of Lake Pichola, the City Palace in Udaipur stands as a magnificent testament to architectural brilliance. This stunning complex, constructed from exquisite marble and granite, showcases an enchanting blend of European, Medieval, and Chinese design elements. Commissioned by Maharana Udai Singh, it took over 300 years to fully realize this royal residence's grandeur.
name: City Palace
address: HPP6+5XH, Ayad, Shakti Nagar, Udaipur, Rajasthan 313001, India

excerpt: Upscale hotel in a 17th century island palace with stylish dining, lake views, a spa & a museum.
detail_description: Jagmandir Island Palace, also known as Lake Garden Palace, is a 17th-century island palace located on the tranquil shores of Lake Pichola in Udaipur. This upscale hotel offers stylish dining, stunning lake views, a spa, and a museum. The palace complex features enchanting divisions such as Gul Mahal, Garden Courtyard, Darikhana, Bara Patharon ka Mahal, Zenana Mahal, and Kunwar Pada ka.
name: Jagmandir Island Palace
address: Pichola, Udaipur, Rajasthan 313001, India

detail_description: Located near the majestic Sajjangarh Palace, Sajjangarh Wildlife Sanctuary offers a wild retreat in Udaipur. The sanctuary spans 1,235 acres and was established in 1884 by Maharana Sajjan Singh. It is home to diverse flora and fauna, offering opportunities for jungle safaris amidst lush greenery where visitors can spot deer, peacocks, and if lucky, even a leopard.
name: Sajjangarh Wildlife Sanctuary
address: HJVR+PMR, Fateh Sagar Rd, near Sajjangarh, Palace, Udaipur, Rajasthan 313011, India

excerpt: Well-known ghat on the edge of Lake Pichola & endpoint for many cultural & religious processions.
detail_description: Gangaur Ghat, located on the edge of Lake Pichola in Udaipur, is a popular destination for cultural and religious processions. It is particularly vibrant during the Gangaur Festival in March or April, when local women celebrate with traditional processions starting from the City Palace, featuring folk performances, chariots, bullock carts, and palanquins. The ghat's serene surroundings make it a picturesque spot for pre-wedding photoshoots.
name: Gangaur Ghat
address: 4, opp. Jethiyo ka Akhada, Outside Chandpole, Pichola, Udaipur, Rajasthan 313001, India

excerpt: Large outdoor zoo that can be visited by golf cart, bicycle, or on foot, with dining facilities.
detail_description: Sajjan Garh Biological Park, located in Udaipur, Rajasthan, is a large outdoor zoo inaugurated in 2005. It is home to various species of birds and animals including tigers, lions, panthers, alligators, ostriches, and more. Visitors can explore the park on foot or rent a bicycle or take an electric cart ride. The park also offers dining facilities for visitors to enjoy.
name: Sajjan Garh Biological Park
address: Fateh Sagar Rd, Main Gate, Malla Talai, Udaipur, Rajasthan 313001, India

excerpt: Square in roundabout of major thoroughfare with a pond, a tall tiered fountain, shops & restaurants.
detail_description: Sukhadia Cir is a vibrant roundabout located in Udaipur, featuring a picturesque pond and a grand tiered fountain. The area is bustling with shops and restaurants, offering an array of quick bites from morning till night.
name: Sukhadia Cir
address: Panchwati, Udaipur, Rajasthan 313001, India

excerpt: Udaipur, formerly the capital of the Mewar Kingdom, is a city in the western Indian state of Rajasthan. Founded by Maharana Udai Singh II in 1559, its set around a series of artificial lakes and is known for its lavish royal residences. City Palace, overlooking Lake Pichola, is a monumental complex of 11 palaces, courtyards and gardens, famed for its intricate peacock mosaics.
detail_description: Udaipur, the enchanting city in Rajasthan, was once the capital of the Mewar Kingdom and is a treasure trove of history and culture. Founded by Maharana Udai Singh II in 1559, this picturesque destination is surrounded by stunning artificial lakes, with Lake Pichola at its heart. The City Palace stands majestically overlooking the lake, showcasing an impressive complex of palaces adorned with intricate peacock mosaics.
name: Udaipur
address: Rajasthan, India

excerpt: Small museum with a diverse collection of vintage cars, rickshaws, horse-drawn carriages & trucks.
detail_description: The Vintage Car Museum at Fateh Vilas by Fateh Collection is a must-visit for car enthusiasts and history buffs in Udaipur. Housed in the former Mewar State Motor Garage, this small museum showcases an impressive collection of vintage cars, rickshaws, horse-drawn carriages, and trucks.
name: Vintage Car Collection at Fateh Vilas by Fateh Collection
address: Fateh Vilas, by Fateh Collection Sisarma, Road, near Hotel Fateh Garh, Bujra, Rajasthan 313001, India

detail_description: The Manshapurn Karni Mata Ropeway in Udaipur was established in 2008 to provide easier access to the remote Machhala Magar Hilltop where the Sri Karni Mata Temple is located. This ropeway connects Deendayal Upadhyay Park to the temple, offering visitors a breathtaking view of Doodh Talai Lake and the entire city.
name: Manshapurn Karni mata Ropeway Udaipur
address: Deen Dayal Park, Doodh Talai, Rajasthan 313001, India

excerpt: Rajput hero Maharana Pratap & his horse, Chetak, are memorialized atop this famous hill.
detail_description: Moti Magri, situated on the banks of Fateh Sagar Lake, is a famous hill that commemorates the Rajput hero Maharana Pratap and his loyal horse, Chetak. The highlight of this site is the striking bronze statue of Maharana Pratap and Chetak, built as a tribute to their bravery in the battle of Haldighati. Visitors can capture picturesque views while strolling through the lush green hill and exploring nearby attractions like the Japanese Rock Garden.
name: Moti Magri
address: Zinc Park, Udaipur, Rajasthan 313001, India

detail_description: Under The Sun Aquarium in Udaipur is the largest public aquarium gallery in India, featuring 150 aquariums and 180 different species of fishes and sea creatures.
name: Under The Sun Aquarium, Udaipur
address: Fateh Sagar Overflow, Fateh Sagar Lake, Udaipur, Rajasthan 313001, India

detail_description: Bada Mahal, also known as the Big Palace, is a stunning architectural marvel located within the historic confines of Udaipur. This 17th-century palace, once serving as the male section of the City Palace, boasts lush surroundings and intricate Rajput-Mughal architectural design. Visitors can admire its blend of traditional carvings and colorful mirrors that transport them back to ancient times.
name: Bada Mahal
address: HMGC+9HV, Trident Rd, Haridas Ji Ki Magri, Shavri Colony, Udaipur, Rajasthan 313001, India

excerpt: Large village featuring traditional huts of regional tribal peoples, plus cultural performances.
detail_description: Shilpgram, located on the outskirts of Udaipur, Rajasthan, is a sprawling open-air museum spread across 70 acres. It serves as a living ethnographic museum showcasing the cultural heritage and traditional arts and crafts of various ethnic communities from rural India. The village features traditional huts representing the lifestyle of regional tribal peoples such as Bhil, Mina, Garasia, Kathodi, and Saharia.
name: Shilpgram
address: JM66+9JP, Shilpgram, Udaipur, Rajasthan 313001, India

excerpt: Landscaped island garden in Fateh Sagar Lake showcasing diverse plants, trees & bird life.
detail_description: Nehru Garden is a picturesque island garden situated in the middle of Fateh Sagar Lake in Udaipur. Spanning 4.5 acres, this oval-shaped garden boasts a variety of plants, trees, and bird species. Accessible only by boat, visitors can enjoy short boat rides from the Fateh Sagar road opposite Moti Magri main gate to reach the garden. The island features pyramid-shaped fountains with colorful lights that add to its charm.
name: Nehru Garden
address: Fateh Sagar Lake, Vasupujy Complex, 5, Mewar Motor Link Rd, Udaipur, Rajasthan 313001, India

excerpt: Chetak Circle is a locality, embarked by a large roundabout in the Udaipur city of Rajasthan state. This is among the popular shopping area in the city. Wikipedia.
detail_description: Chetak Circle is a bustling area in Udaipur, Rajasthan, known for its vibrant shopping scene. It's home to roadside stalls offering traditional Rajasthani handicrafts like puppets, wooden crafts, textiles, and silver jewelry. The renowned Rajasthali emporium showcases authentic local crafts at affordable prices. Additionally, the locality is famous for its street food stalls serving popular snacks such as samosas, kachoris, vada pav, and more.
name: Chetak Circle
address: Udaipur, Rajasthan, India

excerpt: 371-acre artificial pond featuring boat tours & picturesque gardens, surrounded by lush hills.
detail_description: Dudh Talai, also known as the Pond of Milk, is a small lake located at the south-eastern end of Lake Pichola in the city of lakes. This 371-acre artificial pond offers boat tours and is surrounded by lush hills, providing a picturesque setting. The area was once a grazing ground for cows that provided milk to the regal families, hence its name.
name: Dudh Talai
address: Pichola, Udaipur, Rajasthan 313001

excerpt: Hillside Hindu temple featuring a courtyard & a stone idol of Karni Mata, plus sweeping views.
detail_description: Nestled in the picturesque Machla Magra Hills, the Karni Mata Temple in Udaipur is a must-visit for both spiritual seekers and nature lovers. This enchanting temple not only boasts a serene courtyard and a stone idol of Karni Mata but also offers breathtaking panoramic views of the city below.
name: Karni Mata Mandir, Udaipur
address: HM8Q+9M8, Jawahar Nagar, Pichola, Udaipur, Rajasthan 313001, India

excerpt: Entertainment venue offering an interactive wax museum, mirror maze, 9D cinema & horror show.
detail_description: The Wax Museum Udaipur, inspired by the famous Madam Tussauds, showcases 15 lifelike wax statues of global celebrities such as Barack Obama and Michael Jackson. Situated on Sahelion ki Bari Road in Udaipur, Rajasthan, it's a popular tourist spot offering interactive experiences like a Mirror Maze, Horror House, and 9D Cinema.
name: Wax Museum Udaipur
address: mishra marg, 10 Gogunda House Daitya, Moti Magri Rd, Udaipur, Rajasthan 313004, India

detail_description: Jagdish Temple, a creation of Maharana Jagat Singh, is an Indo-Aryan temple located near the City Palace's Badi Pol entry in Udaipur. Visitors ascend a few steps to reach the temple, where they can admire the black stone deity of Lord Vishnu and the facing brass Garuda image.
name: Jagdish Temple
address: Bhupalpura Main Rd, Bhopalpura, Udaipur, Rajasthan 313001, India

excerpt: The palaces of 11 separate rulers sit together in this sprawling complex that was started in 1559.
detail_description: City Palace Udaipur stands as the largest palace complex in Rajasthan, situated on the shores of Lake Pichola. This grand citadel is a fusion of Rajasthani, Mughal, Medieval, European and Oriental architectural styles. Initiated by Maharana Udai Singh II and continued by his successors, each king contributed to this magnificent structure with influences from around the world.
name: City Palace
address: Old City, Udaipur, Rajasthan 313001, India

excerpt: Regal hotel on a lake offering lavish quarters with butler service, plus a spa & fine dining.
detail_description: Taj Lake Palace Udaipur is a luxurious hotel located in the middle of Pichola Lake, offering opulent accommodations with butler service, a spa, and exquisite dining options. This regal resort was built in 1746 entirely of locally sourced marble and showcases the intricate designs and majestic architecture of Rajasthan. Guests can immerse themselves in royal experiences while indulging in Mewari delicacies.
name: Taj Lake Palace, Udaipur
address: Lake Pichola, Pichola, Udaipur, Rajasthan 313001, India

detail_description: Neemach Mata Mandir, also known as Mahakaleshwar Temple, is a revered Hindu temple in Udaipur dedicated to Lord Shiva. Situated along the picturesque banks of Fateh Sagar Lake, this ancient temple has been drawing devotees for nearly 900 years. The temple offers breathtaking views and can be reached after a challenging yet rewarding 1 km hike.
name: Neemach Mata Mandir
address: JM7G+788, Fateh Sagar Rd, Shilpgram, Udaipur, Rajasthan 313001, India

detail_description: Bada Bazaar, situated just 2 km from Udaipur's city center, is a bustling shopping destination offering an immersive experience. The market boasts a wide array of shops, showrooms, and exhibitions showcasing the rich cultural heritage of Rajasthan. Known for its traditional clothing collection, it features renowned batik and bandhani print sarees in vibrant colors and intricate patterns achieved through tie and dye techniques.
name: Bada Bazaar
address: G N P, * LACE, Girdhar Das Nathu Lal Parikh, 179, Moti Chohatta, Bada Bazar, Bohrwadi, Udaipur, Rajasthan 313001, India

detail_description: Sheesh Mahal, situated within the Leela Palace in Udaipur, is a luxurious dining destination that offers a royal experience under the starry sky. The name 'Palace of Mirrors' perfectly captures its opulent ambiance, adorned with intricate glasswork and reflective surfaces that transport diners to a celestial realm. With stunning views of Lake Pichola, this open-air restaurant seamlessly blends regal heritage with contemporary culinary artistry.
name: Sheesh Mahal
address: Pichola, Udaipur, Rajasthan 313001, India

detail_description: A beautiful garden with a variety of plants and animals. The garden is adjacent to the national highway and is free to visit for anyone. There are washrooms available nearby, as well as a separate area for kids to play. The garden also has a zip line, which can be enjoyed for 50 rides at least.
name: Mewar Biodiversity Park, Amberi
address: Udaipur Byp Rd, Amberi, Rajasthan 313024, India

excerpt: Traditional dishes served in a lakefront venue with City Palace views & outdoor seating.
detail_description: Ambrai Restaurant, located at Amet Haveli, offers a romantic dining experience with its lakefront venue and stunning views of City Palace. The restaurant serves a variety of cuisines including North Indian, Mughlai, Continental, and Chinese. Guests can enjoy traditional dishes such as tandoori aloo nazakat and Daal-Baati-Churma while taking in the breathtaking scenery of Lake Pichola and iconic landmarks like Jag Mandir and Sajjangarh Fort.
name: Ambrai Restaurant
address: 62, Ambrai Rd, Chand Pole, Silawatwari, Udaipur, Rajasthan 313001, India

detail_description: Jagdish Temple Rd, a bustling market area in Udaipur, is a shopper's paradise offering a wide range of traditional items. Visitors can find adorable puppets, wooden toys, colorful tapestries, painted wooden pieces, vibrant cloth lanterns, and handmade postcards. The shops also feature mud and metal articles along with camel leather journals and terracotta and metal curios.
name: Jagdish Temple Rd
address: Old City, Udaipur, Rajasthan 313001, India

excerpt: Meats & vegetables are cooked on charcoal grills at this stylish BBQ eatery with a picturesque view.
detail_description: Charcoal By Carlsson is a stylish BBQ eatery in Udaipur known for its wide variety of Indian and continental cuisines. The restaurant offers picturesque views of the Jagmandir Palace and Lake Pichola, making it one of the best places to enjoy a rooftop dinner in the city.
name: Charcoal By Carlsson
address: 12, Lal Ghat Road, behind Jagdish Temple, Old City, Silawatwari, Udaipur, Rajasthan 313001, India

detail_description: Pratap Gaurav Kendra Udaipur, situated at Tiger Hills, is a sprawling complex spread across 25 Bigha land. It pays homage to the Legendary Maharana Pratap and Mewar's history. The main attraction is the 57 feet tall seated statue of Maharana Pratap on top of a hill.
name: Pratap Gaurav Kendra Udaipur
address: near Badgoan, Tiger Hills, Manoharpura, Udaipur, Rajasthan 313011, India

excerpt: Hindu temple with a striking carved entrance gate, colorful paintings & garlanded elephant statues.
detail_description: Bohra Ganeshji Temple is a 350-year-old Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Ganesh, known for granting the wishes of its devotees. The temple features a striking carved entrance gate, colorful paintings, and garlanded elephant statues. It is one of the sacred pilgrimage centers for Hindus and Vaishnavas, attracting hordes of devotees every year.
name: Bohra Ganeshji Temple
address: Ganapati Nagar, Udaipur, Rajasthan 313001, India
